website_summaries.verdict: A super-affordable option for projects that don't require expensive hardware. If studs are not 16 inches on center, users may need to drill new holes, but this is not a difficult operation.
pros: Solid support pieces with an attractive powder finish
Ideal for ADA access conversions and customized barn doors
cons: Written instructions pose a challenge, but instructional videos exist

customer_reviews.title: High quality barn door hardware for reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I built this door from scratch and knew we wanted the rustic mounting hardware. I researched the web and studied all the specs for each option that looks like this one. They are all almost identical and this one was by far the best price. Great instructions, all the required hardware included and it go4es up just like it is supposed to. The entire insatll and hanging took less than 2 hours. Great look and great quality!
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great price, even better quality!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hardware to replace an awkward door at my office, and I constantly get compliments from my clients about how it looks. I am very impressed with the quality and durability of this kit. Pros: 1. Price 2. Very solid and durable 3. Looks great Cons: 1. Split top bar (looks solid once fully installed, so really no cons for this) Will definitely be buying again and have referred several clients to this kit.
customer_reviews.author: Hills78945

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Kit
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this barn door track kit. All the parts needed to hang a door with great quality and decent directions. Best value I found for this type of door. I bought two tracks for two doors I made. The rollers are nice, big and quiet!
customer_reviews.author: RJS

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware
customer_reviews.text: Awesome so we made our own barn door to separate the matter bedrrom from the master bath turned out AWESOME. this hardware was great, no issues, very simple but professional. My door access or walk thru is 32" wide. So this worked great and still had room about 6" if I wanted to make the door bigger. 👍👍
customer_reviews.author: sean Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: This worked awesome for our custom barn door that my husband made
customer_reviews.text: This worked awesome for our custom barn door that my husband made. Looks super classy as well. My only recommendation would be to also purchase a floor guide (sold separately) so that the door does not swing out on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Holly M.

customer_reviews.title: Sliding Barndoor Everything...
customer_reviews.text: Kit was very straightforward and easy to mount on a door we build. Very customizable and looks as great as it works. We built a simple door and mounted this in our wine tasting room where a traditional door would not work well. All our guests love it!
customer_reviews.author: Todd G.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap hardware hurt the quality.
customer_reviews.text: Basically good design and value, but I'm dinging it two stars for the monumental pain in the ass it was to fix this problem! I got the top hardware all together and in final tightening, broke off two of the wood screws. I had to take the whole thing apart to remove the last piece. It only had about 3/8" sticking out of the wall. I had to crank it out with vise grips. I suggest that if possible, use 5/16x6 bolts through the wall if you have access to the back side. Now i have to go to the hardware store and buy replacement screws that a 68 year old gray haired old fart can't break!
customer_reviews.author: William E. Keiser

customer_reviews.title: What a great deal!
customer_reviews.text: What a deal! Umax quality is awesome and this comes at such an affordable price! Install was easy. I had to use a header board because my wall studs weren't in perfect line for this product. BE SURE to measure the distance between the holes in the track. The instructions were maybe slightly unclear? or wrong. I marked where I was going to predrill my holes in my header for the track and checked the track against the marks to find that the marks were off. Other than that, install was super easy and looks and works great!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan E.

customer_reviews.title: Make sure your studs are 16" apart
customer_reviews.text: So this has predrilled holes at 16" apart (that must go in studs btw) and yet not all studs in homes have that spacing. We had that fun discovery while installing it. One of the holes hit nothing. We were able to get all of the others in and wedge the screw in, but it is totally decorative. If your studs are 12" apart or 14" or anything besides 16" this will not be fun for you. Once in though it is amazingly sturdy. We hit enough studs to make it work and I'm really excited about it. Install is not done yet, but I'll try to remember to post pictures once it is.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Great product with a good price!
customer_reviews.text: This worked great! Easy to install. I did install a 2x3 painted to match the wall color to hit the studs then the bar to that, since my studs were inconsistent. Slides smooth! Even though I checked for level, when installed it was slightly off level and would roll open on its own (because it moves so smoothly and easily). An easy fix was to glue a magnet at the stop so it holds perfectly and still easy to open. Great product with a great price. All the needed pieces were there.
customer_reviews.author: Holly C.

customer_reviews.title: They work great! Not to mention this set
customer_reviews.text: This is the third set of barn door hardware that I've gotten. Each with a different brand name, but identical product (although the first set I got was quite a while ago and the pre-drilled holes were set to European measurements instead of 16" centers). They work great! Not to mention this set, with the 8' track was almost $100 less than the set at Home Depot with a 72" track. Again...different product names, but the exact same product. I think I'm done with barn doors in this house, but will use this product again in the next house, I'm sure.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine Haywood

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: When I first started looking for a sliding door hanger everywhere I checked they were very expensive. I finelly checked out Amazon and this seller was the cheapest and my first thought was cheap on money cheap on quality. I went ahead and ordered one set and was surprised that not only did this seller send pkg FAST but the quality was far and above my expectations, After I installed (Which I must say was simple) this hanger set looks and performs excellent, so excellent that I ordered 2 others to the same quality and satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Bill1370

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. We ordered a second one and have been happy with both.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly strong, well built with a durable finish
customer_reviews.text: I installed two of these on doorways where a standard hinge door would not work. I am very impressed with the versatility of being able to cut the rod to the length I needed for the smaller bathroom door installation and the beefy, good looking construction of this barn door system. One comment on the installation instructions though, the horizontal measurements are incorrect for rail placement for a 36 inch doorway. Check door overlap open and closed before you drill your mounting holes on the wall. I will be purchasing another set this fall when I remodel my master bathroom!!
customer_reviews.author: McGiver

customer_reviews.title: Great product and really nice looking
customer_reviews.text: *If you are a sensitive person, you might have a hard time with the bearing smoothly sliding along the joint of the two main steel bars. It is possible but it takes some time.* Nice looking and it’s sturdy too. I made a much heavier-than-average door but the door has been hanging in there really well for the past two months already, even though my kids have sometimes roughly used the door. Really impressed with the quality for the price. I do not have plans to make another door but if I do in the future, I will be buying it again.
customer_reviews.author: azerothforalliance

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty solid barn door hardware kit. It’s pretty much the best you can find for that price. It looks really good too, but with that said there are a few problems. The install bolts for the rollers offer almost not flexible in size. So if you use a thinner wood you will need to purchase new bolts. The bone notch that connect the two piece of rod together didn’t fit together right. I need to use a angle grinder and sledge to get them aligned perfectly straight. It’s not perfect but again for the price it’s par none.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin King

customer_reviews.title: Double check you have all materials before it's too late.
customer_reviews.text: Product itself, awesome and beautiful. Tip for buyers: when you buy and receive the item, DOUBLE CHECK THAT YOU HAVE ALL ITEMS. we bought this for our home that we are currently remodeling. Didn't have to open or install it right away so we never checked it. When we were at a the point of installing we noticed they didn't sent us all the parts. We're missing a wheel. So we have one barn door up and will be out another $20-$30 for just one wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory Stadtmiller

customer_reviews.title: Great kit, 100% would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Was able to install this very easily without looking at the directions. Just youtube a few install videos and you wont even need to look at the directions. For reference, I am not a major technically inclined person, but I am good at hanging pictures and maybe a few shelves. This took 2 hours of actually work time spaced across 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality track at an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: I am a residential remodeler and have been installing barn doors for years. I wanted a barn door for our master bedroom, but was not willing to pay as much for the track as my customers are willing to pay for theirs. This is a great alternative to a "custom" track for way less money! The pre-drilled hole spacing makes it unlikely that you'd be able to mount it right to a wall without tearing out drywall and installing blocking behind it. I recommend mounting a head rail (nailed/screwed into studs) and then mount the track to that using the pre-drilled hole spacing.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation. Perfect condition
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered this product from this mfg more than 7 times. Easy installation. Perfect condition. Gorgeous look! Couldn't ask for better!
customer_reviews.author: Kim Starr

customer_reviews.title: A Very Good Deal for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: OK I love this slider. I was apprehensive because a few people said the split rail makes it go bump but I realized that is not it, it is actually the pieces you put between the wall and rail. If you put them on with the large end away from the wall, the wheels of the sliders bump them and it seems like it is the track break but it is not. Just flip them around. Took me 2 days to install, including painting the wood to sink the rail into as well as the door. Saved me a ton of room in the bathroom and in the hallway of my 120 year old house.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Easy and affordable
customer_reviews.text: Ok so the barn door craze and hype is through the roof! Of course we wanted one and it turned out pretty cool! (Still need to paint the door pictured) if I were to suggest anything: if it’s new construction put blocking up behind your Sheetrock so you can make sure your rod can screw to something solid. Yes the pre drilled holes are on 16 in centers... but if you want it stuck into a corner or something weird the holes will not line up where you need them. Mine tucks behind the fridge. You can also put up a “decorative board” in order to get the backing for the screws if they don’t line up with studs
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Fain

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy and very well built
customer_reviews.text: wow! very sturdy and very well built. BUT all the dimensions in the book appear to be wrong! not a 1 worked! this is clearly built and designed for a solid door without molding! so basically all interior doors are hollow and have molding. And therefore the holes for the brackets must be placed on the edge of the door and hope there is wood behind it!!! also the through door bolts hit the moldings of the door... AND u better hope u have a header above the door cause the holes won't line up with your studs. I am very mechanically inclined so only minor problems here. but u need to know all this before attempting this kit
customer_reviews.author: Chashawna

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed in this barn door hardware kit. I am using it on a console and already ran into my first issue and I have not even got started. The directions are not very good and the measurements that are given are completely off. I am scared to drill holes for fear of ruining the whole console that I custom built.
customer_reviews.author: D. Randall

customer_reviews.title: Requires at least 4" of clearance
customer_reviews.text: This is a decently priced piece of hardware. The instructions are poor and do not label the items in a way that are clearly understandable. The diagrams aren't user friendly either. Be aware that you will need about 4" of clearance above your door to be able to properly install this product, so if your door is taller than that, you will (like myself) be unable to use this product to install your door. I wish there were more detailed reviews that went over items like this prior to me buying as I would return this if I had the chance. Oh well. Live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: William L

customer_reviews.title: Nice and easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty basic setup, but it is pretty sturdy. The bars lock together (kind of) to help with installation. The lug screws are of good quality, and the bar is relatively heavy duty. We recently purchased another, and I immediately wished I had re-ordered one of these. I do recommend that when you install it that you first install a 1x4 to the wall. I screwed the 1x4 in place and then cut the Sheetrock. Then I screwed the board to the studs. If you do this, you aren't as limited in placement.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: not easy to install
customer_reviews.text: this item is made of a preatty hard metal wish is good it is also good looking but it is not easy to install at all it comes with precut holes for the screws a think 16 inches apart. That in a perfect house might work but not all the studs are 16 inches apart so not all the screws will get into the wood. I had to cut a pice of wood and screw it into the studs outside of the wall and then screw the rail to the pice of wood so tha it can be solid
customer_reviews.author: Roxana Estevez

customer_reviews.title: Right price for these things
customer_reviews.text: Nice for price. It appears that almost all of these are made by the same manufacturer- and the range of price between vendors is pretty wide. It turns out that my wall studs are not on 16” centers along the entire length of the track. That was not the track’s fault. The header board used to compensate for that actually improved the look, I think.
customer_reviews.author: DrDWilliams

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty parts that look badass
customer_reviews.text: I would give this a 5 star if the holes lined up with the wall studs. I used a piece of 1x2 and painted it black to match the rail. I bolted the 1x2 to the studs, then mounted the rail to it. The hardware is very nice and the track is sturdy. I mounted a 4ft heavy bard door with it and it worked great. I was looking at hardware stores for parts to build a rail, but they were not nearly as sturdy as these.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Tech Guru

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother
customer_reviews.text: Bolts/nuts on back (wall) side of door supports stick out further than the track sits off wall, causing them to dig into your walls as you try to slide the doors. Had to remove bolts and slant doors outward from bottom to clear the walls - terrible design!! Where we also had to place track to align doors didn’t align with studs, so we had to drill holes through track to place properly for support, leaving pre-drilled holes in the track to have to cover up. Really poor design - your hardware doesn’t work with your own hardware.
customer_reviews.author: alawman

customer_reviews.title: 13 foot arrived as two 6.5 foot sections that DO NOT join together
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful hardware and just the right touch for his and hers closets. The rolling bar arrived as four 3+ foot sections that join together to make two 6.5 foot runs. I ordered the 13 foot so I needed a continuous 13 foot run ( the 4 sections should have all joined together to make the run). I was able to line up the hardware so there was only a little "bump" as the doors slide over this spot. The joined sections didn't fit perfect but we made it work. Other than that the hardware was great!
customer_reviews.author: brenna d

customer_reviews.title: Barn door strong as an ox
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! Super sturdy and strong. Well thought out construction. Slide smoothly. Well worth the money. The ones at name brand stores are more expensive and no where as strong. If I where to get another barn door this is what I would buy. Only thing is to make sure you have studs every 16 inches. I have an old house and did not have studs every 16 inches so I had to tear out the drywall and fit that. Otherwise it is amazing! Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Becky F

customer_reviews.title: Extremely attractive and excellent value
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality product for a great price. Other reviewers have covered the ins and outs of installation. They could do a much better job with their directions, but it is fairly straightforward. My door was not thick enough, but that was easy to solve with a couple of pieces of thin wood on the back side of the door. Having the barn door has greatly improved the efficiency of my laundry room. I plan to buy more of these, it truly looks wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Gardengirl

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware, great price
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this purchase so far. We built our own barn door and decided to buy hardware online since the only kit we saw at Lowe’s was 150.00. This product had good reviews and I liked the unique shape. It has worked perfectly! It rolls smoothly and looks great. I can’t comment much on installation since my dad did it but he said it went up as he expected. I would definitely recommend this over the really expensive hardware kits!
customer_reviews.author: Dan h.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bracket and quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice Quality. Did not use the floor guide as you would have to router out the bottom of the door and drill into tile floor. Bought guide rollers that mount to molding and worked nicer. This application saved so much room in my bathroom, as I have it sliding behind a tall cabinet. Being that I have a log home, and a log beam in the way. I attached one of the roller brackets to a 2x4, so that I could get my clearance at the top for the rollers. Used it like a story pole.
customer_reviews.author: AMDoItYourself

customer_reviews.title: Overall I'm happy but quality control could be better
customer_reviews.text: Not overly impressed with the lack of quality control on this product. I ran into some really wonky nuts that were way off center and the one page of "instructions" that were included was just about useless. Since I was using a backer board I wasn't overly worried about the poor measurement complaints I've read so, in the end, the price was right and it is a heavy duty kit. Did just fine with the heavy door I picked out to separate my laundry room and half bath. I would recommend for sure but only if you were using a backer board or a similar application. Not sure I would trust this kind of poor QC to hit studs.
customer_reviews.author: JAC

customer_reviews.title: Smooth as silk
customer_reviews.text: Slides smooth as can be. You have to screw this into studs or if that's not possible you need to open up the wall and put in something as it will not hold unless it has a solid object to screw into. (drywall isnt going to cut it) That aside, it works great, I made and mounted a 100lbs door on it. It slides open or closed using a single finger :-) It slides so good, you have to have it perfectly level or the door will drift to the lower side.
customer_reviews.author: Tim B

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the product/shipping time.
customer_reviews.text: Supper easy to put together have not tossed it up just finished assembling the door and it's definitely nice quality and didn't take more than 30 minutes to slap together. (Including unboxing and grabbing drill bits.) The wood pegs make it easy to slide together. God sent after I delt with another vender (home Depot) that couldn't provide a door at twice the price for over a month.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: One of the best values I've found in a while.
customer_reviews.text: These are great--I purchased four! I'm using them in new construction so we did not have to worry about the holes not matching up to the studs. We were able to place blocks between the studs before the drywall went up. This is heavy, quality hardware. If you can work around the holes being 17" apart, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tami

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, quality product
customer_reviews.text: Good, solid product. Everything included in kit seemed to be sturdily made and well-crafted. Powder coating was smooth. We had a question for the distributor and they got right back to us with relevant and helpful information. The price was a very fair deal for everything included. We bought it for cheaper than we could have made it.
customer_reviews.author: Weeduwee

customer_reviews.title: J hook design is more ideal
customer_reviews.text: Used on a lightweight door. Not sure how it would hold up with a solid heavy door. Our use was simple. Seems fine. We like the J design because it seems to be much stronger than not having that second surface to mount too compared to a regular strait design. Very inexpensive compared to competitors prices of similar design.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, solid, good instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price! One half of the rail was slightly bent from end to end but absolutely not a problem once installed. Pro tip- check your measurements! Especially with carpet, give yourself a little extra room. I did not measure well and my door drags on the carpet. Not The fault of the product at all, hence the 5 stars. The instructions were accurate and fairly easy to follow. For the price I’m super happy and the hardware will hold more weight than The 3/4” header I installed it on. This could easily hold a super heavy door. (Mine is pine). It also looks really nice!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fair quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: The value is there but the finished quality was a bit disappointing. Where the two rails join together is not flush so the wheels make a loud noise and the door movement is not smooth over the joint area. Simple fix using a grinder but was not expecting to have to do any fabrication. Also the holes did not align with the studs in my case so I had to drill additional holes through the rail. All in all, not bad for the price and you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Dmart375

customer_reviews.title: Good Looks for a Lower Price
customer_reviews.text: Less expensive than the kits at chains like Home Depot, Lowe's, and Menard's, but just as nice looking. Because of the placement of our wall studs, my husband had to drill a couple new holes to correctly place the top rail on our wall. But that worked well, and it looks great. It was fairly easy to install, too, and it functions well. We didn't use the included floor guide, but instead bought one through Amazon that is made by Feldpro, which attaches to the wall instead of the floor.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Horseshoe kit doesn't have 16" on center holes
customer_reviews.text: The description needs to be clear that the horseshoe 6.6 ft kit does not have holes predrilled at 16" on center, which is standard for stud spacing in US construction. The holes are predrilled at 17.7" for that particular kit. The description for the j-shape 6.6 ft kit specifically says the holes are now drilled at 16" on center. I thought that the same rail would come with the horseshoe kit, but it did not. I'm very disappointed that I will have to drill more holes in the rail to make it connect to the studs. I am not confident that placing a 1x4 on the wall will make it hold my 100 pound door.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley S.

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: The plastic door guide is a joke, and the predrilled holes allow zero zoom for studs that are off a bit. I found that I had to drill my own holes as the studs were not all 16" on center since it is a door way. I think it would look better if I was able to drill all my own holes, as needed rather than having my holes I used plus their empty holes, just not very pleasing to the eye.
customer_reviews.author: Josh T

customer_reviews.title: Modernly Pleasing
customer_reviews.text: Installation was quick, and the finished product EVEN BETTER looking than expected. Use this every day for my studio, and very satisfied with the end result. I see that many complained about the fact that the rail comes in two part, but for moving/traveling with this kit I think it's practical and with the system in place haven't seen a reason to believe it faulty as it is sturdy and held by one of the bolts . It would be great though if they did include an extra bolt in case you overtighten one and it snaps, LOL!
customer_reviews.author: Rudolf Roux-Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Great kit for Barndoor
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made set that is relatively easy to install. They could have included a template and better instructions but it's not rocket science. Put the hangers on your door, use a level, make sure there are no obstructions to the movement of the door and you're done. Have bought three of these so far and would buy again
customer_reviews.author: John Haslam

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware
customer_reviews.text: Pro contractor, first time using barn door hardware, very impressed with quality especially for price, was quoted 3x price by my lumberyard, not sure what else they could have offered, but would definitely use this brand again, customer was please, easy to install, what more could you want.
customer_reviews.author: andrew nadraus

customer_reviews.title: Hardware looks Great!
customer_reviews.text: Hardware looks Great! Works as Described and looks good to. Just make sure you order the other Heavy Duty Guide that I reviewed. That is the only thing that I would change. Make sure your wall are straight and not bowed anywhere. Holds up to 200 lbs. Heavy lag bolts needed installed into studs.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Lyles

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, works great, cost effective
customer_reviews.text: Good alternative for tight spaces with 2 out-swinging doors on adjacent walls. *when both doors can ONLY swing out d/t small spaces like tiny bathrooms, entry/exit doors in front and back, closets, etc. I used this on my bathroom door which is just a few inches away from vestibule door. It was a cluster corner in this old cinder block farm house. Had to add some trim to extend past door molding and level it out but it works great! ***Easier with 2 people who have read instructions first! 😂
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Every bit as good as far more expensive hardware
customer_reviews.text: Second set of these that I have purchased. They are made of VERY heavy gauge steel, the rollers are heavy duty with quality ball bearings for a very smooth rolling action. I mean you had better get that top rail perfectly level or there is not enough rolling resistance to keep the door from opening or closing on its own. Every bit as good as the kits the box stores want three times as much for.
customer_reviews.author: Lataine Brown

customer_reviews.title: I gave it 4 stars because I didn't like the way the multi part rails in each kit ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 sets of these and made 2 sets of hallway doors...one set for washer dryer closet and another for a wide hallway closet. I gave it 4 stars because I didn't like the way the multi part rails in each kit would to be pieced together when combining 2 kits. I went and bought 4 pieces of iron rail from Home Depot, drilled my own holes and used all the hardware from the kits (less the steel rails) to build 2 set of double doors.
customer_reviews.author: tomd

customer_reviews.title: Slides great & holds the heavy door, did take some trial & error before it was up correctly
customer_reviews.text: Not the greatest photo, but after a good bit of trial & error my boyfriend got everything put up and the door slides really well. The biggest issue was, the screws it came with didn't go into my wall because it was concrete not drywall or wood. We also had to mount the wheels to the back side of the door instead of the front because it wasn't sitting against the wall correctly. Regardless, I am happy with how it works now that it is done.
customer_reviews.author: Star

customer_reviews.title: We bought 3! They are perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I was a litlle concerned about quality due to lower price compared with similar item. But the quality of the product is great. The instructions maybe need a bit of improvement but we figure it out. We installed 1st one in about 45min, the other 2 in less than 30 mins. Yes, we bought 3. Guess that says all about how happy are we with this product. Perfect product, great materials, easy installation. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Look great
customer_reviews.text: My husband installed with no issue. I am pretty handy around the house myself but there is some skill to leveling this product so that your door flows nicely. This definitely us not product specific and is a skill required for all door slides. Regardless great product and looks nice!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: We love the look and function of this bar door hardware set. It was super easy to install and is a very heavy duty bar. We put a board up behind the hardware for extra support and the function has been great. The rollers roll super easy and are quite as well. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Tillery

customer_reviews.title: Solid hardware for a fraction of the cost
customer_reviews.text: Tried to buy this hardware at a local hardware store, and was surprised to that they charged 4x the cost of this one. Took a chance and ordered this one based on the good reviews, and it definitely lived up expectations. Using for outdoor use and so far no issues. Solid barn door hardware, made of metal, no issues in finishing. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Maria K.

customer_reviews.title: Smashed and missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: Package delivered like it was shipped around the world. Box beaten with lots of tape and both ends open. When opened it, most small boxes smashed up. I noticed alot of pieces missing including 2 arms and 2 wheels..not sure what else....metal seems very thick and heavy but shipping it back due to missing pieces... to be fair have not heard back from vendor yet. Will decide where to buy next one.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Koff

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This product was a great price. It looks nice, and I was excited to install it. However, at installation, as I was tightening one of the bolts, it completely broke in half. I now have half a bolt in the wall and cannot remove it. With the placement of the holes for the other bolts, I cannot do anything without removing the other four bolts and moving it down an inch of so. And I'll have to buy an additional bolt at the hardware store. Also one of the wheels was bent at delivery. I had to bend it back in order for it to fit. I really wanted this to work, but the craftsmanship just isn't there.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: Worthless waste of time...we waited several weeks to get this item. The box showed up broken and torn. We opened the box and half the pieces were unwrapped and scratch. Despite this, we were still going to use it since we had waited so long, but found that it was missing several key pieces and missing the instructions. This was clearly a return and there was zero quality control to ensure that the product didn't go out broken and missing parts. We called customer service and they said we would have to wait another 2 weeks for a replacement...nope. Whoever allowed this to be returned and then reshipped wasted our time, Amazon's time, and their company's time.
customer_reviews.author: S M

customer_reviews.title: Unconventional usage—easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: I used this barn door hardware to add a broom closet to my laundry. Awkward 10” wide 40” deep area to the right of my stacking wash/dryer. Created a vertical drawer, attached hardware, all my brooms and mops are conveniently stowed away. Floating drawer doesn’t mess up my rug, makes unusable area very handy.
customer_reviews.author: outsider

customer_reviews.title: Great value!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this!!! It worked out perfectly. Had no issues with the directions. When installing take the time to ensure that rollers are set exactly as they should be. I made sure I mounted this spacers on top of the door then used my track as a guide to where the rollers needed to be bolted to the door. I read a lot of complaints about the predrilled holes not lining up with their studs...easy fix!!! Just mount the rail to a backer board and lag bolts that to the studs. I built my own door to cover a 36"opening, my door is 41" wide and solid wood, it is extremely heavy and it still glides smoothly along the track.
customer_reviews.author: Mb

customer_reviews.title: Great quality nice finish
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and half the price from local box stores for this length of track. Come with all hardware and instructions. Only thing I didn't like was the guide for the bottom of the door so we bought a different style. The one included want you to cut a groove in the bottom of the door for it to slide in.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: 8’ Rail Is Two Pieces, But Will Work For Most Applications.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 8’ rail for installing a large sliding door under our deck leading to a chicken coop/run. The parts all appear to be heavy duty, however the 8’ rail is two pieces. Even though the rail is two pieces the joint interlocks together and a bolt secures the joint from coming apart. Overall I’m happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: D.Lagro

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this hardware for a home made shed for our side yard. Very happy with the quality and workmanship of the sliding door. It doesn’t include a handle, so we’re off to find one...other than that, it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Martha & Jim

customer_reviews.title: Dimensions are not quite right
customer_reviews.text: For the most part, this is a great kit. Having never installed one before, I trusted the dimensions they gave. Turned out the door touched the floor when done. Being that there is no adjustment, the only real option was to trim the bottom of the door.
customer_reviews.author: Handy Mark

customer_reviews.title: Best buy
customer_reviews.text: I have installed at least 50 of these, which I highly recommend plus another 10 more expensive ones from other sellers that I would not recommend. I can count on the U-Max to show up on time or early, to be properly packaged and to be of good quality every time. These are identical to the $170 ones from the box stores. The door stops could be better designed because they can strip easily but this is a minor issue and care should be taken when tightening. The rail is two pieces and fits better one way than the other. Test fit it and you'll see what I mean. This is a good product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Saka

customer_reviews.title: Nice product but not for my cabinet door application
customer_reviews.text: i was building a TV console based on Ana White's design and they recommended this hardware. The problem is that the Ana White design calls for a 3.5" frame and these require 4.75" clearance above the door. They are also on the large side so are probably better suited for full size doors and not cabinet doors.
customer_reviews.author: Sequelman

customer_reviews.title: Great product and price
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how overpriced these sliders are - so I was glad to see one finally with a reasonable price! We installed this - took a little while to get right but once it's up it's beautiful, smooth, beautiful. The door is heavy - maybe 80 lbs and I built it myself but this kit had no problem handling the weight.
customer_reviews.author: Tanager

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and great value, needs an expert installer especially if you use heavy door
customer_reviews.text: I like the value for the hardware provided, works flawlessly. However people need to know what they're getting themselves into and I would not recommend an amateur to take on the project because it takes more planning for the support and prep work than the actual final installation It literally took me a days to do it because I had to remove thick molding around the old frame, then patch, drywall properly and paint. Also I should have used 2inch larger door... learned a lesson, but I am satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Tomas Sustek

customer_reviews.title: Did the job great, only a couple issues.
customer_reviews.text: It's not a bad product. It seems to work very well with the custom plywood door I made. Two issues I have with it is like many others, I had to drill two holes since my joist didn't line up exactly 16 inches to pre drilled holes. Second issue i have is directions are not very good. I suggest you estimating your stops and putting them on at the beggining. The directions have that last which means you need to take everything down again and rehang it all.
customer_reviews.author: Ogiee08

customer_reviews.title: inexpensive but perfect for the master bathroom door!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this barn door track! Great value! Compared with one at HD for $189. I've hesitated w/installing a barn door on bathrooms before (because they were the main bath & provided no security for guests!), but THIS one was on a master bath, so a prefect place for one. It still locks (w/the optional lock we found elsewhere on Amazon) but of course still allows light to leak around the edges.
customer_reviews.author: kevin w kiefer

customer_reviews.title: Did the job as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: For the price this barn door kit was as advertised. The core components have a solid construction. I gave only four stars for a couple issues that I had. The instructions are horrible so you pretty much can toss them. Secondly the metal parts are nicely powder coated, however the coating on some of the components came chipped away. Not a big deal but it’s not quite black in color and was really hard to match with basic spray paint. These are nitpicky things for the price but thought it was worth mentioning.
customer_reviews.author: RedRaider24

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful door!
customer_reviews.text: This door was an inexpensive option over other ready made and finished doors. It is made of pine so it's not too heavy. It was easy to put together and the staining process was great. This is a good option for a DIY and once it is stained and installed, is comparable to doors 3 times more expensive. No hardware included and we would have purchased a different railing. It also does not come with a headboard if you need one. The cost to add a headboard is minimal < $10. I highly recommend this door for those DIYers that may not have previous experience in making and installing a sliding barn door.
customer_reviews.author: vicki gitzen

customer_reviews.title: Great item. Directions aren't the best - had to ...
customer_reviews.text: Great item. Directions aren't the best - had to run through a lot of trial and error. After the dust settled, I couldn't be happier. *tip: save yourself some headache by mounting the rail to strong piece of wood, then mount the wood to the studs.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: High end for inexpensive price!
customer_reviews.text: Finally got it installed due to us waiting on the project. This kit is excellent and looks high end. We made our own door and used different hardware but it still looks really nice. Heavy duty and the rollers roll nicely. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a TWO piece rail.
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT one single 6.5 ft bar. This is two pieces and the joint does not look like it would hold the weight of a door. I expect that the bars will separate and you will feel it on the rollers. I did not even try to install. I am returning and finding one with a single bar, or a better connecting piece. You definitely get what you pay for here.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great kit for the price!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not the first time I have used this brand. Also made a Ana white console cabinet and used the 8ft version of this kit. Kit has everything you need. If your studs don’t match up, you might have to run a header board either behind the sheet rock or counter sink 4-5”lags to secure a header board to the studs then mount the railing to the header board. I had to do both due to this door weighing 140lbs. You can look at the picture and see.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Smooth Glide
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy door rail by feel, touch and the hardware that comes with the package. Installation Instruction are clear and black finish durable. I like the feel how the door glides, it have a very solid feel. I purchase two of this rail and both performs very well.
customer_reviews.author: CoolPlace

customer_reviews.title: Pieces Replaced Quickly
customer_reviews.text: The sliding rod comes in two pieces. They fit together using a male side and a female side. After receiving two female sides with my original order, but the company quickly replaced the entire product without any hassle. It was easy to install, and it glides very nicely. Give yourself time for installation, but it works well and looks great!
customer_reviews.author: Valla

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: This set is super easy to install and extremely sturdy as well. I’ve installed plenty of theses tracks before with no issues and with this brand specifically. Today’s set was very disappointing in that it was missing screws and spacers needed to complete this install for a customer of mine. It delayed the job by hours to find what was needed to finish and more money to be spent. Especially due to the Covid-19 situation most hardware stores are either closing early or not open at all which just made this situation more difficult not only for myself but for my customer as well.
customer_reviews.author: Nisia

customer_reviews.title: simple to use
customer_reviews.text: This makes the 2nd sliding barn door kit I have bought from this seller , and so far haven't had any problems with either , was simple to install after a little planning , would recommend this seller if you want the kit everything that you need comes with it .
customer_reviews.author: charles

customer_reviews.title: Works well instructions aren't great
customer_reviews.text: Works well and a great price as the kits and pre made doors at the retailers are crazy expensive. as barn doors are the craze right now. Instructions don't seem to be very good I think the math for hanging height is off. Plus hardware not accurately represented.
customer_reviews.author: J Mac

customer_reviews.title: Very complicated to install
customer_reviews.text: This was very heavy duty but incredibly hard to install. My husband and son-in-law have construction backgrounds and this was complicated and required adding a header plus the need to slice the bottom of the door for the bottom track system. Plan on this taking hours to complete. Bottom broke 10 minutes after installation. Very disappointed after doing research on this product and seeing the great reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive but worth the money
customer_reviews.text: We bought one...made a door liked it and bought another one....its not top of the line by any standard...but for an inexpensive nice looking and works well.....you will have to buy a door guide separately...it goes on the floor....
customer_reviews.author: Moonbein

customer_reviews.title: Works "OKAY"
customer_reviews.text: Door comes off the rail rather too easily. Rail wheels should have a much deeper groove. Update 7/15/2018: I really don't like this design. Several times per week we need to re-mount the door. Its a matter of time before the door falls off completely.
customer_reviews.author: Ursan

customer_reviews.title: Great product but..
customer_reviews.text: I am currently enjoying this product very much! If I have to be critical, I will say the directions are a bit lacking. I guess if you are a contractor or someone with a lot remodeling skills, then you'll be fine. My husband installed the system. We had to put up a ledger board because our studs didn't line up with the lags. However, the track is very smooth and made with great materials! I recommend this over paying hundreds of dollars at Lowes or Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Measure your door before buying this. Hope u get all the parts
customer_reviews.text: Missing washer for the 6 screws that connect the long bracket to wall. Missing screws size n for the other door thickness. Disappointed as we were newrly through building and then we had to find alternate so the hinges to fit snug on the door
customer_reviews.author: krystal alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Great but...
customer_reviews.text: Nice and heavy weight the downfall is the spacers should be a tad bit longer otherwise the screws hit the wall .. currently trying to find a way to make up that hair of a difference so it stops rubbing the wall
customer_reviews.author: P. Cropley

customer_reviews.title: Now I want sliding doors everywhere
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I envisioned. Chose basic kit and it’s perfect for the door my husband made.
customer_reviews.author: Ivonne

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat the price or quality!
customer_reviews.text: This is the third one I’ve bought and I’m still amazed at the quality and price! This one was a returned product with blemishes but you can’t even see once it was installed. The finish on this brand is unlike the black spray painted one that you can pay $150 at your home improvement store. This has a rustic dark brown finish. Love everything about it!!
customer_reviews.author: Lori In Vegas

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for the price. I build a lot of what I call “Industrial Rustic” things. I have a habit of insanely over building everything with over the top bolts and hardware (I like this type of look). That being said I put the included bolts and nuts into my misc. hardware box and super-sized everything. Their bolts would have been sufficient for the job but not for the look I’m after. The steel is good quality. It took considerable effort with good tools to re-size all the holes up to 1/2”. No real complaints and I don’t ever expect products to come off the shelf the way I want them to be (I modify Everything)..
customer_reviews.author: Yukon

customer_reviews.title: Always have a missing part!
customer_reviews.text: I had to write this review. The product is nice, but is not easy to assemble. Why? Well, I’ve bought 7 of them. Which 5 of them came incomplete. Some with missing fasteners, not bad, I can get them here, but some with missing “half bar” others with missing “wheels”. Those you cannot get them here. I tried to make a return under “Missing Parts” but when I went to mail it, I had to pay about $50 for shipping when it originally cost me $60 including the shipping. So, I don’t recommend this product. It’s a headache when you open one and find out you have a missing part.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge W. Irizarry

customer_reviews.title: This was totally amazing. Very sturdy and well worth it
customer_reviews.text: This was totally amazing. Very sturdy and well worth it. I was concerned about the wheels and amount of heat they will be exposed to but after I assembled it, I have no dought that it is going to be totally fine in the 110+ degree heat. The only regret was the size and that was my fault. My door is 4' on my shed and I got the 8' hardware. This reduced my door width down by approx 9'. I should have gotten the next size up and maintained the total 4' door width. My wife and I have already planned on three other places to install them next. Totaly recommend​ the U-MAX 8FT Sliding Barn Door. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice kit. The instructions leave a little to be ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice kit. The instructions leave a little to be desired, but they work. The main issue with this kind of project is that they are generally a custom job and you need to be flexible with how you mount the hardware. This kit is a great savings from what you will pay at one of the big big box hardware stores.
customer_reviews.author: Snyguy

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase and product.
customer_reviews.text: This product was found to be of great quality, ease of installation, and worked exactly as advertised. I will admit I had to make some modifications, but this was only because of the area and purpose of which I was using it. It worked out perfectly and looks great. The only thing I can add is I would recommend the purchase of some roller type door guides for the bottom of the door. Other than that this was the perfect purchase and I will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good purchased :sturdy door
customer_reviews.text: The door came in big long box . Wasn’t sure all the pieces were there. Opened it , wood everywhere. The instructions were easy enough . But as we proceeded some screws were missing.!!! Had to go to Home Depot and purchased them. But finally 3 days later put the door up. The price is good, brackets not included. Was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product.
customer_reviews.text: These are being installed by my husband in our new home, and will work out nicely. Easy to build the doors from 1 by whatevers and stain or possibly even leave natural. Can't' wait!
customer_reviews.author: A. Frog

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Loved! So happy i was able to find this! Very easy to install and very affordable! I was concerned it wouldn’t come with all the parts or it would come broken but none of that! Only problem i had was one of the screws was too long and when opened the door it scratched the wall and had to touch up the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Sofia

product_meta.title: U-MAX 6.6 FT Sliding Barn Wood Door Basic Sliding Track Hardware Kit (Basic"J")
feature_bullets: Brand: U-MAX; Condition: Brand New; Material: High Quality Steel.
Door weight capacity: 200 lb; Fit door panel width: 36"-40“; Door panel thickness: 1 3/8" and 1 3/4".
Package Include: 6.6ft(2x3.3ft) Rail,5xRail Spacer,2xRoller,2xDoor Stop,2xEnd Cap,1xFloor Guide,1xHex Key;All other necessary hardware is included as you see in the pictures. For 16 inch stud.
ONLY the hardware is for sale, DOOR NOT INCLUDED.

Support: We are the manufacture of the sliding door hardware. If there is any part missed or defectived during shipping, please let us know, we will send replacement at no charge for missing/defect parts at first time.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars3,475 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
